page.title: 09A CARLISLE SUBURB <2>
page.content: Belle Vue is about two miles from the city centre,so if you want to go into town you have to walk,get a lift or catch a bus.They run every fifteen minutes,but the fares are expensive. One other disadvantage is that there is not much for older children to do except go to one of the parks. We live in the suburb of Belle Vue. The nearest shop is McQuillin's on Eskdale Avenue.My mum just gets bits and bobs like milk.When my mum wants bread she goes to Chambers on Hutton Way.The main of our weekly shopping is done in the town, but my mum goes to Asda in Lancaster occasionally.One disadvantage is getting into the town;there are not many buses because more people have cars.Some advantages are that it is cleaner,there is more space and it is quieter.
